feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 5:22PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RIVER LEVELS ON THE RISE... The atmospheric river moving through the area Wednesday has caused rivers to rise from 0.5 to 2 inches of rainfall. The heavy rain is currently over the central panhandle, but is starting to diminish. Up to 0.5 inches of additional rainfall is expected through the evening over the central panhandle. Area rivers and streams are

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 11:52AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels on Rivers Draining the Brooks Range... Several weather fronts moving across the Brooks Range will bring rising water levels to rivers and streams. Rainfall totals from 0.75 to 1.75 inches are possible through Friday. Some isolated locations could see higher amounts. At this time, water levels are expected to remain within bank and below flood stage. Those

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 17 at 10:17AM PDT until August 17 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Mid level moisture and a hot unstable atmosphere will aid in scattered thunderstorm development this afternoon and evening as an upper level disturbance moves across the region. entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 17 at 12:54PM PDT until August 18 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HOT DRY AND UNSTABLE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY... .HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 90S TO TRIPLE DIGITS THROUGH THURSDAY. THE HEAT COUPLED WITH AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE TODAY AND THURSDAY WILL INCREASE FIRE DANGER. WARM OVERNIGHT LOW TEMPERATURES AND POOR OVERNIGHT RELATIVE HUMIDITY RECOVERY WILL ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO FIRE CONCERNS TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING.
